Pre-Game Insights: Tyrese Maxey and the Philadelphia 76ers host Yves Missi and the New Orleans Pelicans in out-of-conference play.
The 76ers have gone 6-10 in home games.
Philadelphia has a 6-13 record in games decided by 10 points or more.
The Pelicans are 2-15 on the road.
New Orleans is 3-19 against opponents over .500.
The 76ers average 107.4 points per game, 9.8 fewer points than the 117.2 the Pelicans give up.
The Pelicans average 11.6 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.7 fewer made shots on average than the 13.3 per game the 76ers give up.
Maxey is averaging 25.5 points, 5.7 assists and 2.1 steals for the 76ers.
Missi is averaging 9.2 points and 8.4 rebounds for the Pelicans.

In their last 10 games, the 76ers are 6-4, averaging 111.0 points, 39.0 rebounds, 21.8 assists, 10.1 steals and 4.9 blocks per game while shooting 45.3% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 111.8 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Pelicans are 2-8, averaging 111.7 points, 41.6 rebounds, 27.8 assists, 10.6 steals and 6.0 blocks per game while shooting 44.9% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 117.2 points.
Others: 76ers injuries: Joel Embiid (day to day, foot), Jared McCain (out, meniscus), Andre Drummond (day to day, toe), Kyle Lowry (day to day, hip), Paul George (day to day, groin), KJ Martin (out, foot).
Pelicans injuries: Brandon Ingram (day to day, ankle), Zion Williamson (day to day, hamstring), Trey Murphy III (day to day, ankle).
